justification: “Veselka et al. 2014 introduced the Vices and Virtues Scales (VAVS), which includes subscales for Anger (Wrath)….”
The authors note they will borrow “items from … Trait Anger scales for Wrath” when operationalising the construct.
The VAVS is said to have “subscales for … Envy” among the seven sins.
They state they will draw on “Dispositional Envy Scale” items to measure the Envy catalyst.
The text specifies “items from the Dispositional Greed Scale for Greed (which has proven reliable).”
The VAVS is described as containing a dedicated subscale for Greed.
For Lust, the authors intend to adapt “Erotophilia/Sociosexuality scales” items.
The VAVS list explicitly includes a Lust subscale.
They mention using the “Narcissistic Personality Inventory for Pride elements.”
The VAVS contains a Pride subscale among its seven sin measures.
For Gluttony, they will incorporate “Barratt Impulsiveness (eating subfactor)” items.
The article states that the VAVS includes a subscale for Gluttony.
To capture Sloth, the authors plan to use “Work Avoidance/Procrastination scales.”
Sloth is one of the seven VAVS subscales listed.
